info.name: Tarot Weaver (Homebrew)
info.author: Homebrew by User + ChatGPT
info.description: A tarot-deck based class implementing Major/Minor Arcana powers and Courtly Summons. AM = Ability Modifier (Wisdom or Charisma, chosen at level 1).

element.name: Tarot Weaver
element.description:
Tarot Weaver

Hit Die: d8

Primary Ability (AM): Wisdom or Charisma (choose when you take your first level in this class). Any feature that references AM uses the chosen ability's modifier.

Saving Throws: Wisdom, Charisma

Armor: Light armor

Weapons: Simple weapons

Tools: Playing card set (tarot deck)

Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Deception, Insight, Investigation, Perception, Performance, Persuasion, Religion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth.

Equipment: A tarot deck (holy symbol / arcane focus), leather armor, a simple weapon, an explorer’s pack.

Deck of Fates (Core Rules)

  • Upright / Inverse: Most Major Arcana have Upright and Inverse effects. The GM may call for a flip (upright or inverse) when a card is drawn, or you can use advantage/disadvantage or a d2 roll. If an entry says “flip the card,” discard it and draw a replacement at the end of your turn.
  • Drawing & Hand: At the start of each combat, draw a hand of 3 + your proficiency bonus cards from your deck. You may play one card on your turn as an Action unless the card states otherwise. Discard cards you play. When the deck empties, reshuffle the discard to form a new deck.
  • Rest: You regain your full deck and hand after a long rest. Short rests let you reshuffle up to 3 discarded cards back into the deck.
  • Concentration: If a card effect would reasonably require sustained focus, treat it as though it requires Concentration (like a spell); you lose it if you lose concentration.

Leveling Notes

  • Some cards scale by level (e.g., The High Priestess lasts +1 extra turn each 5 levels). Follow the card text below.
  • Summons are available starting at level 5 (Pages), level 9 (Knights), level 13 (Queens), and level 17 (Kings).

element.name: Ability Focus (AM)
element.description: Choose either Wisdom or Charisma to be your Ability Modifier (AM) for Tarot Weaver features. You make any DCs that require AM as 8 + proficiency bonus + AM, and damage or healing that uses AM adds your chosen ability's modifier.

element.name: Deck of Fates
element.description: You fight with a deck of Major & Minor Arcana. At the start of each combat, draw a hand of 3 + proficiency bonus. Play one card per turn as an Action unless noted. Discard after use. If directed to flip the card, discard it and immediately draw a replacement at the end of your turn. Reshuffle when the deck empties.

element.name: Major Arcana
element.description:
Major Arcana — Upright

  • The Fool — Leap of Faith: Teleport unpredictably within 5 × AM feet; you are invulnerable until the start of your next turn.
  • The Magician — Channel Arcana: Amplify the effect of your next spell (damage or healing) with AM. Then flip this card.
  • The High Priestess — Veil of Mystery: Illusions hide you for 1 turn (add +1 turn at levels 5,10,15,20). If discovered, flip the card.
  • The Empress — Bountiful Growth: Heal allies for 1d8 + AM.
  • The Emperor — Authority’s Command: Command a being. If it fails a DC 10 + your Intimidation modifier check, it obeys.
  • The Hierophant — Sacred Rite: Grant Inspiration to an ally.
  • The Lovers — Sacred Bond: Link two beings; they share buffs and healing. Damage/effects to one apply to the other.
  • The Chariot — Victory’s Charge: Dash 15 ft. On hit deal 1d8 + AM bludgeoning. If the target succeeds a DC 10 + AM check, flip the card.
  • Strength — Lionheart: For 3 turns, your unarmed strikes deal 1d10 + AM. While active you may discard one additional card each round to make an extra unarmed attack (max 2 attacks/round). No other Major Arcana can be active. After the duration, flip this card.
  • The Hermit — Lamp of Wisdom: Reveal secrets or enemies within 15 ft (through objects). Enemies make a Stealth save DC 10 + your Investigation modifier. If nothing is found, flip.
  • Wheel of Fortune — Turn the Wheel: Create rough terrain beneath 1d4 enemies (GM adjudicates positions).
  • Justice — Balance: The next attack against you or an ally is reflected. If the attacker succeeds their own attack DC, flip.
  • The Hanged Man — Sacrifice: Give 1d8 + AM HP to an ally; flip.
  • Death — Transformation: End any status effect on a target (ally or enemy). If you heal an ally’s status, flip.
  • Temperance — Alchemical Harmony: Begin crafting a random potion from nearby elements; takes 10 turns. If disturbed, flip.
  • The Devil — Chains of Temptation: Inflict fear on 1d4 random enemies.
  • The Tower — Cataclysm: Fire a beam; on hit deal 1d12 + AM (Dex save 15 half). At impact, a 10‑ft‑wide hole opens. Flip.
  • The Star — Guiding Light: Restore 1 spell slot to each ally. Casting takes one turn; if damaged before your next turn, flip.
  • The Moon — Dreamscape: One enemy suffers hallucinations for 3 turns. If they hit an ally during this, flip.
  • The Sun — Radiant Blessing: A 10‑ft lighted radius heals 1 HP to creatures at the start and end of their turns. If 5 beings enter at once, flip.
  • Judgement — Final Call: Revive an ally.
  • The World — Completion: Redraw your hand and immediately spend one new card.

Major Arcana — Inverse

  • The Fool — Misstep: Teleport to a random enemy.
  • The Magician — Backlash: Take 1d6 damage if an enemy ends within 5 ft of you.
  • The High Priestess — False Counsel: You fall (prone).
  • The Empress — Withering Touch: Curse a creature; over 5 turns they take AM damage each turn.
  • The Emperor — Tyrant’s Wrath: Confuse a being within 10 ft (roll d4: on 1 you choose the target; on 2–4 the GM chooses).
  • The Hierophant — Dogmatic Shackles: Hold a being for 3 turns (DC 15). On a failed attempt, you are held on your next turn.
  • The Lovers — Severed Ties: Make an enemy turn on allies (DC 10 + AM).
  • The Chariot — Crash: Dash 15 ft; on hit deal 1d8 + AM bludgeoning and you take half that damage.
  • Strength — Inner Weakness: You become despondent; your next attack has disadvantage.
  • The Hermit — Isolation: You are blinded for 1 turn.
  • Wheel of Fortune — Downfall: Rough terrain in a 10‑ft radius beneath you.
  • Justice — Corruption: The next attack from a chosen ally has disadvantage.
  • The Hanged Man — Stasis: You can’t move on your next turn.
  • Death — Stagnation: The next attack (ally or enemy) instead heals the target.
  • Temperance — Discord: Your potion explodes in a 10‑ft radius for 1d4 + AM damage; no save.
  • The Devil — Liberation Frenzy: Allies can break free from any engagement.
  • The Tower — Crumbled Ruins: The hole grows over 2 turns; after, it’s extremely hard to climb out.
  • The Star — False Hope: Allies with open spell slots gain 1 level of exhaustion.
  • The Moon — Nightmare: The enemy’s hallucinations spread to a hit ally for 1 turn.
  • The Sun — Scorching Blaze: The circle burns for 1d4 damage each turn for 3 turns.
  • Judgement — Condemnation: An enemy gives up.
  • The World — Collapse: Redraw your deck.

element.name: Minor Arcana — Cups
element.description:
Cups (Healing & Support)

  • Ace: Heal 1d4 + AM to one ally.
  • Two: Heal 1d4 + AM to two allies.
  • Three: Allies in 10 ft heal 1d4; those allies gain advantage on their next saving throw.
  • Four: Heal yourself 1d6 with meditative focus. If disturbed, no effect.
  • Five: Heal 1d6 + AM to an ally who took damage this turn.
  • Six: Heal 1d4 + AM to up to three allies.
  • Seven: Choose 1–3 allies: each heals 1d4 or gains 1d6 temporary HP.
  • Eight: Heal 1d8 + AM to one ally.
  • Nine: Heal 1d8 + AM and grant +1 to their next attack roll or saving throw.
  • Ten: All allies heal 1d6 + AM; remove one minor status effect.

element.name: Minor Arcana — Pentacles
element.description:
Pentacles (Protection)

  • Ace: Grant 1d4 + AM temporary HP to one ally.
  • Two: Grant 1d4 + AM temporary HP to two allies.
  • Three: All allies within 10 ft gain 1d4 + AM temporary HP.
  • Four: You gain +1 AC for 3 turns.
  • Five: Ally below half HP gains 1d6 + AM temporary HP.
  • Six: Distribute 1d4 + AM temporary HP among up to three allies.
  • Seven: Until your next turn, the first attack against an ally is reduced by 1d6 + AM.
  • Eight: One ally gains 1d8 + AM temporary HP.
  • Nine: You gain 1d10 + AM temporary HP.
  • Ten: All allies gain 1d6 + AM temporary HP and advantage on saving throws for 1 turn.

element.name: Minor Arcana — Swords
element.description:
Swords (Martial Techniques)

  • Ace: Deal 1d6 + AM slashing to one enemy.
  • Two (Parry & Riposte): If hit, deal 1d6 + AM to the attacker (they make a DC 10 save to halve).
  • Three: Deal 1d8 + AM piercing to one enemy.
  • Four: Deal 1d4 + AM and gain +1 temporary HP.
  • Five (Flurry): Deal 1d4 + AM to up to three enemies within 10 ft.
  • Six (Cleaving Strike): Dash 10 ft; deal 1d6 + AM to all in your path.
  • Seven (Sneak Attack): Deal 1d8 + AM if target fails a DC 10 Stealth save.
  • Eight (Precision): Deal 1d10 + AM. On a natural 20, roll again and double the effect.
  • Nine (Desperate Lunge): Deal 1d12 + AM; you take 1d4 recoil damage.
  • Ten (Devastating Strike): Deal 2d8 + AM. If this reduces a creature to 0 HP, you gain 1 extra turn.

element.name: Minor Arcana — Wands
element.description:
Wands (Arcane Assaults)

  • Ace (Spark): Deal 1d6 + AM fire or lightning.
  • Two (Focused Bolt): Deal 1d6 + AM; on failed DC 10 save push the target 5 ft.
  • Three (Expanding Blast): Deal 1d4 + AM to up to three enemies within 10 ft.
  • Four (Stabilizing Flame): Deal 1d6 + AM; an ally gains +1 AC for 1 turn.
  • Five (Wildfire): Deal 1d6 + AM to 1d4 random enemies.
  • Six (Radiant Strike): Deal 1d8 + AM; target makes DC 10 save or is blinded 1 turn.
  • Seven (Elemental Surge): Choose two elements; deal 1d6 + AM of each to one enemy.
  • Eight (Rapid Cast): Cast two minor spells this turn, each for 1d6 + AM.
  • Nine (Arcane Overload): Deal 1d10 + AM; on a failed DC 12 save, you take 1d4 damage.
  • Ten (Meteoric Impact): Deal 2d8 + AM to all enemies in a 10‑ft radius.

element.name: Courtly Summons — Pages
element.description:
Summons — Pages (level 5+)

  • Page of Cups: 20 HP, AC 10, speed 30 ft. Heals an ally 1d4 + AM each turn; can cure minor conditions (poison, fatigue).
  • Page of Pentacles: 20 HP, AC 10, speed 30 ft. Grants 1d4 + AM temporary HP to an ally each turn.
  • Page of Swords: 20 HP, AC 10, speed 30 ft. Spectral blade attack each turn: 1d6 + AM.
  • Page of Wands: 20 HP, AC 10, speed 30 ft. Elemental bolt each turn: 1d6 + AM (choose element).

Summoning: As an action, conjure one Page that obeys your commands (initiative immediately after yours). The summon lasts until reduced to 0 HP or dismissed (no concentration required unless your GM requires it for balance).

element.name: Courtly Summons — Knights
element.description:
Summons — Knights (level 9+)

  • Knight of Cups: 35 HP, AC 13, speed 50 ft. Healing waves: allies within 10 ft heal 1 HP at the start of their turns. Once per summon, restore 1d6 + AM to a chosen ally.
  • Knight of Pentacles: 35 HP, AC 13, speed 50 ft. Intercept: once per turn, force an enemy to reroll an attack against an ally.
  • Knight of Swords: 35 HP, AC 13, speed 50 ft. Each turn dash up to 20 ft and strike for 1d8 + AM; if the enemy is stunned, make an extra attack.
  • Knight of Wands: 35 HP, AC 13, speed 50 ft. Elemental blast 1d8 + AM with 5‑ft knockback on hit.

element.name: Courtly Summons — Queens
element.description:
Summons — Queens (level 13+)

  • Queen of Cups: 60 HP, AC 16, speed 20 ft. Healing aura 10 ft: allies heal 1d4 + AM each turn. Once per summon: cleanse one major status (charmed, paralyzed, etc.).
  • Queen of Pentacles: 60 HP, AC 16, speed 20 ft. Aura of safety 10 ft: allies gain +1 AC. Once per summon: grant resistance to one damage type for 3 turns.
  • Queen of Swords: 60 HP, AC 16, speed 20 ft. Precise strike each turn 1d10 + AM; may disarm or impose disadvantage (DC 10 + AM).
  • Queen of Wands: 60 HP, AC 16, speed 20 ft. Each turn cast radiant flames/illusions for 1d10 + AM. Once per summon: grant an ally advantage on next attack or save.

element.name: Courtly Summons — Kings
element.description:
Summons — Kings (level 17+)

  • King of Cups: 80 HP, AC 18, speed 15 ft. Allies heal 1d6 + AM per turn; death saves within 30 ft have advantage. Once per summon: revive a downed ally to 1 HP.
  • King of Pentacles: 80 HP, AC 18, speed 15 ft. Allies in 20 ft gain 1d6 + AM temp HP per turn. Once per summon: create a 10×10×1‑ft barrier wall for 3 turns.
  • King of Swords: 80 HP, AC 18, speed 15 ft. Two attacks per turn (1d8 + AM each). Once per summon: Whirlwind Slash — all enemies in 10 ft take 1d6 + AM.
  • King of Wands: 80 HP, AC 18, speed 15 ft. Each turn cast a bolt 2d6 + AM. Once per summon: 10‑ft radius AoE for 2d8 + AM.
